nodes.text: The EV-series medical droid, also known as the A-series medical droid, or the A4 laboratory assistant droid was a model of medical droid based on the EV-series chassis that was manufactured by MerenData. Beginning their operarional lives as EV-series supervisor droids, the company refitted them as cheap medical units in an attempt to salvage the EV-series. However, their skeletal frames hardly encouraged trust in most patients and the model was largely a failure. The Confederacy of Independent Systems purchased and retrofitted an EV-series medical droid designated EV-A4-D, gifting him to General Grievous to serve as the cyborg's surgeon and cybernetics repair technician.

The EV-series medical droid first appeared in “Lair of Grievous,” the tenth episode of the animated series Star Wars: The Clone Wars' first season, which originally aired on December 12, 2008. It was designed by Atsushi Takeuchi of Production IG, who also designed the show's incarnation of Grievous and directed "Lair of Grivous." The EV-series medical droid was first identifed in EV-A4-D's Databank entry on StarWars.com.

In the original episode guide for “Lair of Grievous,” EV-A4-D was described as a modified supervisor droid. However, his Databank entry identified him as an medical droid. Star Wars: Build Your Own R2-D2 20 would later establish that the EV-series medical droid was based on the chassis of the EV-series supervisor droid, with Star Wars: Build Your Own R2-D2 53 further explaining that the medical droids were supervisor droids before being refitted.
